page.title: 04An Older Resident.
page.content: On Friday{Mr. War}came into school and we interviewed him about changes in the area. Mr. War is over 60 years old. We asked him if he likes the area as it is. He replied that he thought it was improving year by year. Children are better off than when he was a lad. We asked him if Roach Vale Primary School should have been built. Mr. War said "Yes" and that a lot more schools should have been built too.We also asked him if he would like to live in an old people's home. He said "No".He told us that before the Colchester by-pass was built all the traffic going to Clacton and Walton had to go through the town centre. Mr. War's father was often the policeman on duty at Headgate. He had to direct the traffic through the town because there were no traffic lights or pedestrian crossings.
